attributes.action: Retain Channel 4 as a publicly owned broadcaster
attributes.additional_details:
Analysts believe that a privatised C4 would face a 40-50% cut to its £660m programming budget. 

Additionally, it is reported that 90% of respondents to the public consultation said it was “a bad idea”. 

A report published by government found that the number of C4 jobs would fall by 18%. 

Benefits of a cash windfall to government are greatly outweighed by the detrimental impact on the independent TV sector.

Examples of C4 broadcasts: The Great British Bake Off, Gogglebox, Friday Night Dinner.
attributes.background:
Revoke plans to privatise Channel 4. There is no sound economic or social reason to do so.

Privatisation threatens less profitable programmes like news/current affairs and reduces its capacity to nurture new talent/innovation.

C4 does not cost the taxpayer - the money it makes is reinvested.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613995
